devs are active they give out free plat because a lot of the community loves them and they love the community back they try to err on the side of making things harder to get rather than easier mostly a good community some that are too serious and get  off if you dont singlehandedly carry the team its a grindfest its also fun the ui is smooth steep level curve because your weapons are upgraded with mods that have to be found and then leveled up from rank 0 eg serration increases primary weapon damage rank 0 to rank 1 requires 1 unranked rank 0 copy rank 2 requires 2 3 requires 4 etc for 1024 to get to rank 10 some powerfulcommonly needed mods are rank 10 lots are lower some weapons are objectively better not all weapons are generically bad lots of weapons have different feels to them lots of different warframes if you are a completionist you will eventually take issue with the random number generator used to determine if you get a certain part of a certain weaponwarframe you want theres a lot to do in the game update 17 coming soon and it will change how missionscontent are available its fun eleven out of tenno and to clarify there is no paywall you can buy aesthetics with money you can buy inventory space for warframes and weapons and you can buy stuff that allows you to mod your stuff even better however the stuff that lets you mod your stuff better orokin catalystsreactors [potatoes] forma can be found rarely as an alert mission or login reward and there is increasing numbers of alternate cosmetics that can not be bought with money but with ingame currency moreover the paid currency platinum is available to trade for ingame what platinum you can trade for is limited only by who wants to buy what and what you have to sell there isnt a vicious cycle that prevents you from doing this unless youre hoarding all your stuff and refuse to sell anything in the first place

recommended
free to play in the right dirrection so many games that are free to play are like swimming with a lead life vest to get it off you have to pay for the key to properly stay afloat warframe has nothing like that they just put the islands far away as hell and you can choose at what pace you get to them with alot of f2p games 90% of the content is locked behind a wall of money but here its the opposite a vast majority of what you see is free frames characters are all attainable by grinding the pieces and resources needed to build them as goes with the weapons too by default you get one of the base frames and base weapons of your choice with the availability to get 1 aditional frame and eight weapons without paying a single dime with the starting free money they give you its possible to unlock additional frames and weapons spots to have more off the bat the only thing you cannot get free are color chemes some animations and so on but those are all asthetics its possible to play the game end to end without spending any money story is a general mmo stereotype you have control of a powerful character grindy missions save the universe ect not much more to it than that there are very few games i get headlong into the lore of and this is not one of them there may be more than what i said but i dont feel compelled to learn the in and out of every faction there are several starting story missions to get you the required gear to play any game type and an npc companion for free the combat is great controls are tight and responsive popping a headshot is easy the runslide and hump feels natural after a few minutes of gameplay the parkourwall running is a bit buggy but there is no penalty for falling out of bounds as it just pops you back into the level combat difficulty is a bit high later on into the games making it necessary to team up with others to help ease the load but you can jump into a game and play with random players if there are any for the selected mission weapon selection is a bit low as i love having hundreds of guns to play with but they have a decent selection of pistols rifles bows and ultimate prime weapons and power cards to make them all better as you level them up standard affair for weapons rifles snipers bows shotguns smgs and pistols graphics are great im running an nvidia 750 it runs on high settings but not ultra even so its a gorgeous game that looks beautiful through each planetlevel the levels are based off of tile sets and wind up being different missions constructed with the same pieces but a different lay out on each planetship you go through while level designs are endless you start to see alot of similarities over time even with the different variations of each right off the bat this isnt a game i play alot and usually with friends only i am hesitant about spending any money on it as this is more of a social game for me play with friends and have fun if this is your scene and you love the game to death theres nothing wrong with dropping full game price 60$ for the extra stuff as its a very well polished complete title that is worth that much at least as they add more things to do frames to play as you can go ahead and spend more on it i wont blame you however be warned there is several hundred dollars of content to buy if you dont want to grind out the supplies and frame blueprints warframe is bet played with patience and friends everything can be built immediately for platinum the real money currency or bought with it via the market or player trading it can take up alot of hours to get the characters and weapons if you dont want to spend any money off the bat everything aside from the color shcemes can be recieved in game with a bit of time and some higher level friends even if you dont know anyone that plays warframe there is a chat channel that you can ask to join in on higher level missions to level and get better items and resources from the start breakdown graphics 910 story 310 gameplay 910 reliability 810 fun 810 value 1110 quick breakdown be patient gets some friends this is a grindy game if you dont want to spend cash amazing graphics tight gameplay and 90% of the game content only costs time to get

warframe when i first started back on its inital release i was never able to get very far i forgot my account details more than once so i kept restarting then eventaully i decided to take it up agian after wasting a good 36 hours on the game getting annoyed that i was unable to solo missions and never seem to find a group the finding a group problem still persists occasionally but as of late from my standponit my current account is pretty much at the endgame level i cant get into pvp matches as easy as some my rating is just to high p so i started playing recently to find out that they released a new warframe the last time i played was during the mesa update i got some nice mods from that i like the encorperation of the new pvp game mode becuase replaying a mission only entertains you for so long things get repedative and hardly anyone did the conclave arenas clans had their own pvp areas for taking over dark sectors but i wasnt in a big clan just a small one that i was passed the ownership from a freind of mine so overall warframe is a pretty entertaining game when you have the time for it the event missions sure are intense i spent 10 hours trying to get those mods from the mesa update group after group ether failing instantly or at the last minute id go to help a fellow player and die thus losing the chance to get them as far as the pvp goes i would say for example the weapons that i use are pretty op so i feel bad when killing under geared players but overal its rather fun

500 hour mark with this in mind i believe i can make a accurate review this game as of now 1242014 is still a beta in process to be a story filled mmo the basis is you use a character called a warframe to runs strikes on the solar system against arguably 10 factions 3 races and 3 different sets of bounty hunters you are reffered to as tenno the people of the lotus the tenno fight foragainst others to bring balance to the system you are awakened by the lotus to prevent from being captured by the grineer to be used and processed to be their weeaponslaveresource to gain universal domination as it were for the purpose of keeping from spoiling the game ill get into this this is a mmo this is not an easy mmo if you have deep pockets and believe in buying all great gear youll be highly dissapointed because theres this thing called xp locked that keep people like you from ruining this game and speed running it to be better than everyone else in fact the entire game is genuinly 100% free minus cosmetic items like color and skins etc everything in the game minus the cosmetic items can be obtained through simply playing ingame missions give credits which are used to build bluprints to beef your arsenal up there is a achievement labeled for having 10 warframes each tool with its own purpose this is true for the game slash damage shreds fleshy enemies to pieces but sheilded ones left unphased impact bomards shields but armor shrugs it off puncture you guessed it pierces armor but does a whole lot of nothing to shields sheilds save lives all tactics should be analyzed rank up is broken down as follows xp from primarysecondarymeleewarframespooled xpmastery rank the max rank for everything is level 30 including mastery rank if you level an item to 30 you will only recieve xp that counts that first time if you use forma to level it to zero to make it stronger later the other times after the first its leveled to 30 will not count toward your mastery rank every time you hit the xp cap for a mastery rank there is a right of passage type of test to rank if you fail you will be able to try again in 24 hours if you pass then you proceed to the next rank unlocking weapons and other new items there are plenty of weapons i promise you will not run out crafting this is easier than it sounds go do a mission and collect the drops the resources currently are gallium nano spores mutagen samples mutagen mass orokin cells polymer bundle alloy plate rubedo salvage detonite ample detonite injectors fieldtron samples fieldtron oxium nav coordinates nurodes neural sensors last two are not related to each other argon crystal control modules golem nav coordnate morphics cuircuts and plastids none of these are too difficult to find all are used from time to time for different items the more you have on hand the less as much as i hate saying it farming you have to do gamplay you are a space ninja thre is no better way to describe it you do flips wallruns slides and parcour of all kinds be it rolling from a fall or vaulting to a higher spot this is your deadliest weapon each warframe has unique abilities that they use they are described in the market or abilities option in your arsenal 90% of the game is pve clan battles that you arearent apart of you may assist for funcredit earnings conclave is also available as a deathmatch for a morepersonal 1v1 or 2v2 fight as a beta this game is a 1010 nyxsilence

recommended
free to play in the right dirrection so many games that are free to play are like swimming with a lead life vest to get it off you have to pay for the key to properly stay afloat warframe has nothing like that they just put the islands far away as hell and you can choose at what pace you get to them with alot of f2p games 90% of the content is locked behind a wall of money but here its the opposite a vast majority of what you see is free frames characters are all attainable by grinding the pieces and resources needed to build them as goes with the weapons too by default you get one of the base frames and base weapons of your choice with the availability to get 1 aditional frame and eight weapons without paying a single dime with the starting free money they give you its possible to unlock additional frames and weapons spots to have more off the bat the only thing you cannot get free are color chemes some animations and so on but those are all asthetics its possible to play the game end to end without spending any money story is a general mmo stereotype you have control of a powerful character grindy missions save the universe ect not much more to it than that there are very few games i get headlong into the lore of and this is not one of them there may be more than what i said but i dont feel compelled to learn the in and out of every faction there are several starting story missions to get you the required gear to play any game type and an npc companion for free the combat is great controls are tight and responsive popping a headshot is easy the runslide and hump feels natural after a few minutes of gameplay the parkourwall running is a bit buggy but there is no penalty for falling out of bounds as it just pops you back into the level combat difficulty is a bit high later on into the games making it necessary to team up with others to help ease the load but you can jump into a game and play with random players if there are any for the selected mission weapon selection is a bit low as i love having hundreds of guns to play with but they have a decent selection of pistols rifles bows and ultimate prime weapons and power cards to make them all better as you level them up standard affair for weapons rifles snipers bows shotguns smgs and pistols graphics are great im running an nvidia 750 it runs on high settings but not ultra even so its a gorgeous game that looks beautiful through each planetlevel the levels are based off of tile sets and wind up being different missions constructed with the same pieces but a different lay out on each planetship you go through while level designs are endless you start to see alot of similarities over time even with the different variations of each right off the bat this isnt a game i play alot and usually with friends only i am hesitant about spending any money on it as this is more of a social game for me play with friends and have fun if this is your scene and you love the game to death theres nothing wrong with dropping full game price 60$ for the extra stuff as its a very well polished complete title that is worth that much at least as they add more things to do frames to play as you can go ahead and spend more on it i wont blame you however be warned there is several hundred dollars of content to buy if you dont want to grind out the supplies and frame blueprints warframe is bet played with patience and friends everything can be built immediately for platinum the real money currency or bought with it via the market or player trading it can take up alot of hours to get the characters and weapons if you dont want to spend any money off the bat everything aside from the color shcemes can be recieved in game with a bit of time and some higher level friends even if you dont know anyone that plays warframe there is a chat channel that you can ask to join in on higher level missions to level and get better items and resources from the start breakdown graphics 910 story 310 gameplay 910 reliability 810 fun 810 value 1110 quick breakdown be patient gets some friends this is a grindy game if you dont want to spend cash amazing graphics tight gameplay and 90% of the game content only costs time to get

a sciencefiction thirdperson shooter that blows away most other cooperative titles this game has everything you need to enjoy hours upon hours of coop fun with friends that is if you are looking for a game that offers coop shooting with a crafting system and player build customization the draw backs of this game are few but they include some really long grinds repetitive gameplay and a premium pay to grindless scheme that being said the game is truly fun and is a freetoplay so premium grindless is something that should be obvious the one note i will mention which has been the main driving factor for me and my friends slowing off this game is the constant repetitive gameplay that has diminishing returns that coupled by the fact that items ingame that contribute to your overall level and progression mastery are often having the ability to attain them removed from the game which in my mind is contributing to permanent player inequality the mere fact that i cannot receive an item that would contribute to my overall level in the community because i either wasnt playing when it was introduced or missed the opportunity to receive it greatly hinders my will to proceed further based on the merit of completion some may not have a problem with this but others certainly do certain practices i dont quite agree with also include the prime access packs mainly in the area of pricing so to put it bluntly this is an overly adequate game for your time if you so wish to play it there are things that after playing for a while you may realize you dont like but to each his own live long and kill the masses

after picking it back up again after a few months of it getting repetetive warframe has evolved quite a bit gameplay wise it is fantastic very smooth and many manuevers to pull off however it can still become repetitive after a while the depth of the game is better a lot of weapons and frames to choose from all providing unique experiences and evolving combat again and again however a drawback is it appearing pay to not grind as much which puts you in the lategame much faster however there is a huge lack of lategame content in the first place you dont have to pay to be able to max out or anything but paying sure makes life easier such as more warframe slots weapon slots and sentinels the game becomes a grind quickly without paying and having to wait such a long time for built weapons and warframes becomes a drag the lack of level versatility gets annoying but is overseeable warframe is a game that may hold your attention for a few days or even weeks but you wont be able to play it for a long period of time as the game doesnt warrant it without any lategame content or gamemode that hooks you in conversely it it extremely fun to play especially with friends it is worth it for the simple experience of being a ninja in space alone 710

warframe how do i put this warframe is an excellent game and that is putting it lightly warframe is basically about futuristic space sci fi that involves humanity becoming mutated and corrupted the main characters you play as are called warframes which are like awesome space ninjas they are basically either super evolved technology that is worn to keep the corrupted humans or tenno stable or they are the result of mutations to the tenno either way they each have their own unique looks and powers you can customise your ones to your own liking and desire you play the game by doing missions these involve you flying down to a planet in your spaceship then depending on what mission type you are doing you must complete the main objective an example of this includes exterminate missions these missions are your typical and easier missions in my opinion basically the main objective is to go all space ninja on all the enemies till none of them are left standing seems simple enough the more harder missions can include defense or spy missions i wont go too much into what they are as to not spoil the entire game for you new players ive been playing this game for a good few years and it just seems to get better and better as the time goes on the developers add new content at a decent pace and keep us the consumer interested it really keeps me enjoying myself to fullest at every corner however there is only 1 problem with this game in my opinion this problem seems to occur in most free to play games im refering to of course pay to play issue now unlike world of warcraft and other free to play games warframe does allow you to get the complete experience of the game for free they allow this by letting players doing the missions and farming parts of weapons cosmetics even other warframes you can build and obtain for no real money what so ever yay and for those lazy players who cant be stuffed to put the time into farming for the things they want we are able to buy whatever we want for real money a tactical advantage to the devs but can be worth it for us sometimes however there is a catch to those of us who want to get the stuff for free and this is the problem i was refering to that is how the game works with this sure put hours on end to farm the parts and make your new weapons and warframes etc but each warframe weapon etc needs a slot to be placed in within your inventory and guess what that costs real money to get more hahahahaha what a messed up catch sure its not as expensive as buying the thing you want in the first place but its still really cheeky on the devs part letting people get whatever they want for free only to spend cash for space in their iventory to aquire this so called free {whatever you are building}  oh and when you build the stuff for free it does take real hours to be made just another set back for some people me im not as fussed about that as others but besides that little cheeky issue with having to buy slots to put the stuff you want for free in i have absolutley nothing bad to say about warframe its a wonderful game and like i previously mentioned it keeps getting better to some degree d and as such i look forward to the future sessions of playing warframe that are yet to come would i recommend this game hell yeah no questions asked i think the majority of gamers out there would love this if you are a player that doesnt like spending real money on games you already bought then i dont think youd like this too much but other then that d absolutley i recommend this

so the reason ive dicided to do this reveiw now is because of the recent update which has drastically changed my opinion of warframe but ill come back to this later so first off what is warframe basically its a free to play 3rd person coop action shooter with ninjas with a bonus of using swords and lots and lots of other weapons d but the game can also be labbled as a mmo due to its high focus on loot and grinding but the main focus is the actual warframes themselves combat suits with a wide variation of abilitys ranging from invisibility fireballs healing and even teleportation these suits also allows for a ton of parkour moves and melee strikes for when your out of bullets first off things that warframe dose well or differently than other games overall warframes combat a basically rock solid although new players or potential players might find it very basic and it is very basic indeed and boring even repeditive the secret to its combat however is its versitility especially with the new update 13 and melee 20 which revamps melee combat to make it more viable it requires you to creativly use all your abilitys weapons and manouvers warframe also brings this kind of variation to almost everything else almost tons of enemy variations and classes and random tile sets will ensure that even vateran players keep on their toes although ussually bullets will do the job  the biggest plus this game has however is the constant update of content and special events massive content patchs ussually come around ever other month or so and there will be a ton of special events for those who keeps ther eyes and ears open and they offer a ton of awsome loot as for cons there is only one i would mention above all else micrtransaction noooooooo for a game that lables itself as f2p it dosent lie almost all content in avalible to find in game excluding even items and most cosmetics and boosters xp and in game currency however for those who are of the impatient types youll likely drop $10 or more this con is easily passible but there is a ton of upgrade materials that can be purchased with cash and they dont come cheap especially the pre built weapons and warframes on the topic of building you can expect a lot of crafting counters some lasting as little as 1 minute to 3 days just remember to be pacient and take your time  aslo warframe offers little in mechanic explations other than a very basic combat tutrorial youll have to discover everything else on your own there is also a slight lack in mission variety but there are new game modes being added reasonably quickly as my final verdict i strongly recomend anyone give this game a try at least for a few hours and who knows you might like it enough to put down $60 like me yes i know i said its a con but i was worth it and so i bestow upon warframe a 78 out of ten its a solid 3rd person action f2p shooter with solid combat and great coop and a ton of new content being added all the time but watch out for those microtransactions they can stack up pretty quickly

recommended
this is not my type of game at all i normally play skyrim rogue legacy miasmata not shooters and definitely not mmo shooters doesnt matter ive clocked upwards of 300 hours in it because it is just that much fun the game is not about grinding its not about the things you can buy in the shop for cash sure you can drop a ton of money to instantly have all the things that otherwise you have to acquire partbypart in missions but what fun is that virtually every item in the shop drops in missions the ones that dont often come up as special alerts theres no need to spend a single dime  within a week or two you can potentially have an extremely buffedout character that can take on anything the universe throws at it space ninjas so again its not about grinding its about having a fantastic time running along walls vaulting over enemies and mowing them down in whirlwinds of deadly blades bullets magnetic crossbow bolts explosions and a whole host of unique powers you can play stealth brute force tricks and traps there are different warframes for pretty much any playstyle you can run solo  there are missions that are very hard to complete that way but i did a lot of soloing at first and had a great time but you can also take advantage of an excellent missionpairing system to drop into anything you want to play with whoever else happens to be playing it get a bad team yeah you might wipe but most missions are brief  youre probably out a few minutes time ive had some real horrors as runs go but ive had vastly more good groups whod learned the ropes and were actively excellent to work with get a good group going and the game helps you out  the dynamics of attack defense support are highly organic and fluid you learn what makes up a good team and how to back up the different types of companions you might have along the way and if worst comes to worst even on a bad team everyone gets the rewards theyre not split up or voted on you just get what you pick up weaponry is elaborate and extensive and different weapon types have significantly different impact it really makes a difference whether youre running with a set of daggers a long sword fist weapons or a staff sniper rifles machine guns and straightup regular rifles all demand their own kind of tactical attention add that to an incredible array of mods a sort of ingame ccg you can use to buff and modify each weapon and your warframe and the possibilities are virtually endless  just fiddling with mods is its own little minigame one ive sunk far too much time into and dont regret a bit also dont want to pay for cash shop items with real money no problem theres a lively trade in modsforplatinum  you never have to spend a real dime the controls and ui are quite elegant and improving yes youre playing a parkourenthusiast space ninja whats your point when youve sunk some time into it you start learning how to polish your own playstyle and thats a huge part of the fun  the game actively rewards using what you can do with it you can run on run up bounce off of just about any surface and there are a variety of powers that enhance these abilities not to mention innate differences in the warframes mastery of the controls is important but not hard to get used to running a mission well  figuring out how to use the maps to your advantage how best to tackle different enemy situations are all part of the learning process which is why this isnt about grinding at all  if youre not having fun running missions for their own sake rather than the rewards youre missing the whole point are there bad points sure yes theres sometimes lag its a natural downside of hosting on one of the participants machines i havent had a lot of trouble with it and its just one mission  outside survivaldefense they generally last ten or fifteen minutes its not a big deal yes there are bugs yes sometimes theyll cost you a mission your rewards time rebooting the game sure ive said some bad words when one hit me but for the most part theyre transient and as a programmer i get it theyre under incredibly active development putting out releases at an astonishing rate and each new thing is a shiny new toy i get to play with ill take the shiny new toys over perfect programming any day of the week warframe is a really good game  in my books i highly recommend giving it a try

this is an updated version of my old review introduction warframe is a f2p title devloped by digital extremes the studio that brought us dark sector this game is an direct sequel to dark sector taking place in the same universe set many hundred years into the future after the events of dark sector you are a tenno a member of an ancient warrior race that have been awoken from their cryosleep only to find the universe they have sworn to protect in chaos and disarray its now up to you and your fellow tenno to restore balance to this system and discover more about your past for the cryosleep has stangely purged you of such for more information on the lore of the tenno and the warframe universe please visit the wiki httpwarframewikiacomwikitenno general gameplay review now onto the actual review part warframe is a coop third person action rpg set in the distant future of the dark sector universe and has you take up the role as one of the previously mentioned tenno the gameplay of warframe is similar to its predecessor dark sector while also introducing fast paced parkour elements into the game and taking many ques from mass effect 3 its multiplayer giving the players access to class specific powers or in this case warframe specific powers warframes are the games exo suits or heroes that give the players a selection of 4 abilities per warframe each warframe having a unique art style theme and playing style to them allowing you to fill many different roles within your squad while the game has satisfying coop gameplay this game really is a loot based one at its heart youll be picking up mods to improve your weapons resources to build new weapons warframes etc in your foundry and also leveling up said weapons and warframes during your gameplay youll be visitng many unquie planets and locations during your quests across our solar system from the icy planet of pluto the lush rain forests of earth to the floating gas cities of saturn at times the end game grind can be abit too much for some people but if you are a hardened veteran of games like wow diablo or borderlands youll find that this is not as extreme as said games but the fact that the grind compares favorably to these nonf2p games is a saving grace however if you dont want to grind you can always hit up the trade chat and try to trade your hard earned mods parts or blueprints for the things you might need or perhaps even earn yourself alittle platinum while doing so which brings me to my last and biggest point id like to touch on business model review the business model now warframe has a pretty fair business model while you can craft everything in the game in the foundry you can also buy those items with the real money currency called platinum this currency can be obtained by purchasing it with real money or by trading for it with other players with platinum you buy things such as warframesweapons skins & cosmetics extra warframeweapon slots expmoney boosters or rush the construction of items in your foundry  purchasing a warframe or weapon follows around the same pricing model as lol has for its heroes or skins so it is pretty fair as far as f2p goes verdict as of the time of this review i have 1300 hours clocked into this game since its release on steam and probably about 200 hours in the nonsteam closed beta and i have founded the game through closed beta with one of the founders packs master founder while i cant say that this game is perfect or flawless with the previously mentioned end game grind that might get a bit tiresome for some people or the business model which might annoy you i however will still say that this game is a great f2p title and amongst one of the most fair ones at that overall warframe is a great f2p game with a loving devloper behind it who continuously reach out the community put up amazing ingame events host livetreams to share what is comming up and discuss recentupcomming changes with the community all while also answering the hard questions that we ask them so if this game sounds interesting go and give it a look afterall ninjas play free also pink shorts

my updated review to warframe the game has improved 110% since the earlier beta stages there are now practically 0 errors and the steam overlay is completely cooperative and helpful the guides available give a starter and veterans alike a sense of understanding the game playing to your strengths and improving weaknesses warframe connections are much better established although rarely youll join an unoptimized session but the negatives in regard to the positive are completely null pros overall great gaming experience high fps great use of computer mechanics great choice of playstyle amazing choice of weapons how and what you want to play as expanded mission base as well as amazing replay value once mission stage is complete good growing group of followers and players doesnt feel like its in beta improvements through regular updates improve the game tenfold would highly recommend this free to play visually stunning game that deserves high scores in critical reviews

before you decide to jump into warframe you must understand what the game is it is a massive grind fest many people are turned off because of how repetitive it is most of the time you will be doing the same thing for hours at a time leveling and farming for materials it will get old for people who dont enjoy this type of play style all of the items in the game aside from some cosmetic things are obtainable through means of farming and crafting that is where 75% of your play time will be spent while 25% will be spent on leveling said items that said if you enjoy any grindfest i recommend warframe space ninjas guns warframe

this game is amazing i dont need to tell you the reader to download this game just do it ok now to write a serious review kind of thingy the gameplay is fluid and smooth it feels to me being predominantly a xbox player like a mixture of halo and titanfall but in thirdperson and a lot more fast paced and energetic than both of those games either way the variety between frames and weapons is great but there are some exceptions of weapons that are just weaker versions of other weapon cough akzani and akstilettos but other than those there isnt much in the way of simular weaponry the gunplay is brilliant all the guns that ive tried anyway feel great to use and have the oomph that really make them feel effective aswell as being effective the game looks great from a graphical standpoint the music is spectacular and the sound effects make the weapons sound beefy and feel great to use aforementioned above since the title update 14 came out not long back the game is more beginner friendly and there isnt a better time to start playing now the bad points that need to be present in every review the business model for the game is pretty bad you as the player will require to buy slots for warframes and weapons to be able to build half of the things that you would want say that you had a set of weapons that you really like and you threw an orokin catalyst maybe a forma or two on each of them and then you see another weapon that seems interesting to you or want to try it and see what the fuss is all about but you have no slots and you cant claim the weapon until you sell one of you hard earned or you buy some slots to get more there is always the option not to but if you dont then you will be limited to a small amount of warframes and weapons its the same situation with warframes and in my opinion it subtracts from the overall enjoyment of the game if you have this limitation of having two warframes and eight weapons my next point is the waiting time for building weapons frames and some materials like forma and fieldrons fieldrons can also be obtained from invasions as with detonite injectors but since it is a freetoplay game this sort of thing is inevitable simular to the buying of slots weapons and frames on the subject of buying weapons and frames and other accessories that can be bought with the paid for currency platinum most weapons and frames can be bought with platinum and this sort of thing can lead to a pay to win basis but some of the best gear in the game primes can only be found in the higher tier missions in the orokin void but they can also be bought with prime access which involves the buyer spending a large amound of money for the latest primes that have been released and some other exclusive accessories that can only be obtained with the prime access yes i agree that this is either pay to win or breeching what is or isnt pay to win but this is the sort of game where equipment isnt everything and skill can play a big factor in who would be the highest performing player in the mission some more good points and a general rap up of the review you must be a champ to get this far a good majority of the games weapons and warframes can be bought with platinum but if you have mods and prime parts to sell people in the trade chat will gladly buy those off of you for platinum or high tier mods and or prime parts so arguably the game can be effectively played with spending any money on it at all having started my own clan in the game the clan tech research is a fun thing which can be done on top of all the other things that are done in the game also there is customizing the clan dojo itself which can take a very long time to achieve anything in conclusion im 327 hours in to the game and i have enjoyed every minute of it i have spent 30 $50 on the game that was enough for me to get all the weapons and frames that i wanted and some materials on top of that to help with the dojo and the construction of my zephyr warframe my philosophy is that if you got at least 1 hour of entertainment for for 1 you spent on the game then you have got you moneys worth out of the game lastly i fully recommend this game to anyone out there who has the pc to run the game which i may add doesnt require a great pc to run so come join us tenno for further information visit httpwarframewikiacomwikiwarframe_wiki or httpsforumswarframecom

the year is 2005 the gaming world is awaiting the dawn of a new era the xbox 360 and playstation 3 have been announced a well known developer digital extremes best known for its collaboration with epic games on unreal tournament has just taken the stage at e3 to show off its new concept dark sector for months and months it is the talk of the town it was the first real  next gen  footage httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvu3jw2xkqja shown before next gen was even a thing unfortunately the project known as dark sector took a very drastic and unwanted turn as lead creative designer steve sinclair told me last year at pax east  there was this thing called call of something duty  chuckeles  and everyone wanted world war ii games and so our scifi dark sector idea got shelved which caused allot of pent up frustration however as time passed and wwii games became less popular and with the emergence of this thing called  free to play  steve and company thought this would be a good time to really focus on their original idea expanding on the original concept warframe was born you are an ninja tenno to be exact fused with this ancient armor known as a warframe the lotus a being responsible for waking you from your cyro based slumber awakens you with the task of waking up fellow tenno in a on ongoing war against the grineer a savage race whos soul purpose is to conquer and enslave anything in their way including the tenno warframe is a pve game with some pvp elements which take place in what are called conclaves again steve talked about why they went in this direction  we were looking around and there were just so many pvp hard core death match games that we decided we wanted to take warframe in a different direction and make it coop you team up with other fellow tenno to take down waves of grineer corpus and the havok causing infestation among the constellation there are tons of planets to fight in and objectives to do to be fair at the writing of this review there is allot of  washrinserepeat because the game is still in beta however from the time i spent with steve and rebecca  community manager  at pax to the most recent update 11 patch this game has gone through huge changes and improvements the story is slowly but surely being developed and the abilities that you can attach to your warframe called mods have been tweaked and improved the game plays much like steve said  borderlands meets mass effect there is also a foundry where you can use blueprints to make new warframes weapons and item components you can even have you own clan with a dojo that you can decorate train in and build weapons items and blueprints at a discount price in all warframe is an amazing game from some truly amazing developers this is not just another game thrown out there to be a  farmville cash cow but a well thought out scifi shooter with a deep honor system and a great community of players from all over the world most of the conversation with steve was fun and light hearted but when i i asked him this question it became a little more serious  if that is possible for stevehehe i asked him where he saw warframe 5 years from now he said  wow 5 years i cant think past this month and this upcoming update i can say this though the whole team is very dedicated to this game it is our baby it is not just another game it is very personal i personally have clocked in well over 120 hours and can tell you that it is the f2p game of the year httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvihdxuqqxa9q&featurec4overview&listuusonhuuu663e_gsgb3iazbw so hopefully i have awakened you from your sleep tenno and hope to see you on the battlefield we need you score  810

recommended
warframe is a free to play fastpaced third person shooter that can be best described as space ninjas developed by digital extremes warframe follows the adventures of the tenno during a war with the grineer a race of militarized humanoid clones tenno soldiers bear a warframe  effectively a futuristic and alien combat suit  into battle as well as a primary weapon a sidearm and a melee weapon the game is essentially a sequel to dark sector taking place about a thousand years after its events its a game built on two very solid features exciting gameplay and awesome gear at its heart warframe is all about the action combat is intense and blazingly fast the tenno can sprint slide and dodge out of hairy situations as well as being able to run along walls and displaying quite a fair collection of parkour motions players can sneak around a map and melee an enemy from behind for elevated damage but its nowhere near as fun or as easy as running into a crowded room guns a blazing theres a much heavier focus on staying agile in a gunfight rather than being sneaky each warframe has its own set of unique abilities and stats giving each one a diverse feel from the other a wide array of weapon types keeps the combat fresh and gives the player a multitude of ways to play guns feel impactful but melee weapons tend to feel a bit floaty with an astounding amount of different enemy types and bosses levels can produce a variety of challenges theres even a oneonone pvp feature in which players can duke it out these are called conclaves and are limited by a point scale to keep players of relatively equal skill fighting against each other while it is nice to see a human player react with unpredictability a lot of the ai in the game is very predictable in its actions theyre still difficult but it takes away from any sort of surprise if youve already squared off against that enemy before also it is highly recommended that you play this game with friends and a common goal in mind it can get stale quickly without those two things despite that theres still an immense amount of fun to be had in warframes fastpaced shooter action warframe is visually stunning and i dont mean just for a free to play game this game is gorgeous for any type of game theres a great attention to detail lighting effects are cinematic environments are vibrant with color however youll see many of the same settings over and over again while they are pretty to look at seeing what seems to be the same map several missions in a row gets very tiring the slight blur that is created from constant movement will distract from any minor visual flaws  flaws that youll have a hard time finding to begin with this is actually one of the few games in which ive fired my weapon solely for the purpose of hearing how it sounds the guns sound incredibly real and impactful and even though each gun has its own distinct sound most of them manage to sound pretty good it certainly outdoes the gun sounds that are apparent in more successful shooters like call of duty warframe is just full to the brim with varying types of gear warframes essentially character types are plentiful and number well into the double digits each player has three weapons a primary a sidearm and a melee weapon there are a multitude of primary weapons such as rifles shotguns bows and snipers sidearms include full auto and semiauto pistols available melee weapons are swords staves axes and more these weapons can be bought with platinum  the equivalent of real world money  but are also easily obtainable through the ingame currency known as credits weapons must be built by first purchasing their blueprints and then having the items required to build it items are scattered as drops throughout the planets and while theyre entirely useless on their own they can be used in unison to create some really interesting weapons however items have build times weapons generally take twelve or twentyfour hours while warframes take a lengthy seventytwo this can be a bit bothersome to those without patience but items can be rushed to completion by spending a certain amount of platinum this gear can also be modded with a plethora of upgrades depending on how the player see fits resulting in a huge amount of customization a single weapon can be made to play several different ways depending on the mods the player has installed on it this creates an experience that truly is different for every player and item while most free to play games suffer in terms of story and narrative warframe actually does a very successful job at this well partially its narrative is weak and lacks integration into the gameplay the average player will just plow through the missions without even realizing theres a plot going on most of the plot will be found in the codex a menu in which players can read up on the lore it takes a while to uncover and quite honestly ive only scratched the surface but its chockfull of sciencefiction goodness there are questions of morality and the tennos purpose in the universe there are references to dark sector proving that the two games exist within the same universe its certainly very interesting and easily dominates in a market where story tends to be an afterthought another strong point one where it stands above its competitors in the free to play market is the incredibly fair balancing of real world and ingame currencies almost anything that can be obtained through the cash shop can be found as loot or created via a blueprint most of the items that cant be obtained without spending some cash are purely cosmetic such as color palettes and weapon skins however in a game that is so gearcentric its a shame to see so few free inventory slots given to the players even still prices are pretty reasonable shelling out cash doesnt put players too much ahead of others and the small gaps that do exist can easily be closed by player ability its nice to see a free to play game that doesnt put a huge chasm between its paying and nonpaying players and that certainly is a huge advantage for warframe in its market one of the biggest drawbacks of warframe is its perpetual state of open beta things can change from patch to patch whether they be minor updates or huge ones that drastically overhaul something like the ui this results in a large amount of bugs theyre not common and prevalent in every mission but youre bound to run into them fortunately they tend to stray far from gamebreaking and are usually just minor annoyances overall warframe is a great addition to any collection as it is able to balance fantastic gameplay gorgeous visuals impactful sounds an interesting story stellar optimization and a fair currency system and its free did i mention its free i would like to see more integration of its impressive lore into the gameplay as well as more free inventory slots but apart from those setbacks it is a great game that should be given a try by anyone who enjoys some fastpaced action and the reload wheel as of update 12 is pretty awesome

warframewhere to start first of all this is the only game ive spent more than 700 hours on in all of my 20 or so steam games there are many reasons for this and i shall describe all the pros and cons of this game in this text pros this is the only true free to play ive seen in my life everything in the game weapons characters cosmetics etc is avaiable to f2p players but requires some grind to compensate cosmetics colors shoulder pads chest pieces capes etc can only be aquired with platinums the currency you have to buy with real money but guess what you can get platinums for free by trading stuff with other players you dont have to pay a single cent to play this game and get everything if you have a bit of time to invest in it the coop experience is present and intense a great game to play with friends the graphics are good and will run smoothly on any decent computer and if you dont have a such computer well you can lower the graphics and you probably wont even see the difference exept for the fps boost the game is updated very frequently and gets a huge update every 3 months or so digital extreme is very commited in making warframe the best f2p shooter out there very developped movement system you can run on walls and do some epic tricks you can roll while airborne you can slide on the ground and so much moreyou are a space ninja many warframes to choose from all warframes are different and each one has some cool and unique superpowers and rolesplaystyles one is a slow tank with crowd control another can place shields that block bullets and my favorite one zephyr can even fly random encounters sometimes you will get messaged by special mini bosses that will try to assasinate you in a near future when you are in a mission rumors say they drop epic loot on death and are particularly deadly cons as you progress further in the game lower level missions tend to get way too easy but they are still enjoyable the opposite is also true a low level player trying to take on a level 30 mission will get wrecked at current times the late game content is somewhat poor as the only thing left for vets to do is progress through mastery ranks and max out all their gear but again the frequent updates keeps the veterans playing as more and more content is added i also heard rumors about some lenses of power that will add some serious late game content for all the accomplished players upon their release enemies are a bit stupid their ai needs more polishing but that is far from making this game boring  in conclusion this game is a model for all the f2p out there it stands on the top of shooter games list and its definitely the best f2p steam can offer you by retro050

ive been trying to compose a review that truly shows all the experience i gathered while playing warframe for so long and it is still hard to put in words i am a player that is filled with joy when a f2p game launches or is available as an open beta i enjoy gaming i really do f2p is an attribute linked with many positive and many more negative aspects in my humble opninion warframes f2p aspect with real money currency and what you spend it on is probably the most balanced in all of f2p history eventhough the prices are pretty steep this review will mostly cover the f2p or p2w aspect i am too lazy to write a review for the gameplay part which is fine and steadily evolving to be better than before lets get the important things out of the way first shall we pay to win p2w warframe is a coop game at its core nobody loses when a teammate is stronger but not fun breaking stronger what makes him stronger a weapon or a warframe character that has yet to be build by you or your clan  can you build it or are you restricted as a f2p gamer to never play with such glory yourself no all it takes is time and resources  so i grind to be able to grind more it is not an prehistoric asia mmorpg where you spent weeks in the same spot to kill the same enemies just to upgrade your wood dagger to a copper one resource drops have been raised and are at the moment laughable high no shortcomings whatsoever  then why should i spend platinum real money ingame currency in the first place if you are a lazy bum with a lot of money but nearly to no time to play you can buy warframes weapons and various random mods used to upgrade warframes and weapons etc directly from the store to support digital extremes in their efforts to please the community there are even a ton of cosmetics to make your warframe and weapon look like you want it to look like _ wha have you spent money on this piece of carp no i have not and i doubt i ever will i am a real money pincher and i like to test out the limits of every f2p game out there till i see either a huge paywall that blockades content or whatnot or a f2p turns out to be a real pay to win fest where gamers who do not wish to spend money on it are getting their gamer souls squeezed out  can you acquire platinum in another way except spending real money yes you certainly can and i encourage all of you to do so there is an economic system in warframe you can trade anything of value and anything tradeable there are some restrictions for every player be it mods parts for weapons and warframes prime variants of weapons and warframes only or other stuff open to trade i obtained my platinum by trading mods with a fellow player now i have enough platinum to spend it on the real essential stuff i would only spend it on  what did you spend it on in theory you have acess to every weapon and warframe in the game problem is you do not have enough space to fit all of them in your arsenal thats why you have to unlock additional slots for your inventory 20 platinum for 1 warframe slot  12 platinum for 2 weapon slots used to be 20 platinum for 1 weapon slot if i remember correctly but they changed it for the greater good  but what about platinum exclusive purchases they exist but are mostly cosmetics and booster xp credits or resources nothing you will feel left out of cosmetics are fine so are boosters in this case there is no gambling aspect where you can burn away 100$ worth of platinum and get nothing in return the sanity level of the devs is too damn high to allow such things tldr  warframe features an exemplary use of microtransactions in the f2p genre no shortcomings for gamers who do not pay  platinum is obtainable through trading ie not spending real money in fact you even get 50 platinum for free as a new player  the essential purchases are indeed the most affordable warframe and weapon slots 20p for 1  12p for 2  you are not hard pressed to spend money or get a constant reminder that you should such marketing harassment does not occur in warframe  as the engines name suggests  this game is evolving and you can expect a major update every month update 14 being the latest and hotfixes like crazy i do not know what else to say im getting tired i just hope some of my thoughts are reaching your ears properly and have answered some important questions if not feel free to ask in the comment section and i or someone else will answer them best regards

cooperative cyborg space ninja third person action rpg do i have your attention yet having witnessed the evolution of this game from its infancy i can say that it has grown into a unique peice of gaming that will certainly garner its place in the hearts and minds of people coming from just a handful of warframes this games version of character with premade stats to an abundence such that there is almost always one to suit any playstyle within the third person market in terms of graphics it has come a long way the lighting and animations have come to a crisp smoothness that a lot of other freetoplay titles simply havent gotten to the biometal or whatever the suits are made up of look organic but have the deflecting power of metal which makes for an interesting change when youre sliding across a metal surface and hear the suit grinding against the ground combat is almost always fast and fluid with hoards of enemies attempting to do everything in their power from keeping you from your objective with varying enemy types going head long into a wave of enemies can be fun but the unprepared should be ready for a quick death finding your niche is easier since there are plenty of people in the community who are willing to pull you along to get the warframe of your choice by getting you the parts to build it crafting is simple to learn and essencial to maximizing your arsenal as well getting the right gun could just be a matter of getting the materials to build it if it turns out to not be that great sell it off and craft again until you find that one youre willing to put money down to get a orokin catalyst and enhance it further for a fraction of the cost it would have been to purchase the weapon outright who knows you might even find an event and get the catalyst completely free the final and most important element of the game is the mods these can completely alter the way some of the warframes play out even some of the weapons get an extra kick current personal favorite is the kunai throwing knives with a 170% chance of an additional shot at the same time thats right i get the possibility to throw a third with each toss of a blade and deal massive damage finding this kind of combo for your weapon is just a download away enjoy

after 100 hours on this game i think im more than capable of writing a review first of all this game is the best play to win model in free to play titles out there you need not spend a cent to get anything you just need to play and get stuff ingame to build things ingame using ingame credits thats it secondly this is an awesome game youll never get bored here its rewarding and fun and you dont have to play alone at all there will always be three random people out there who will join you in a game or you can invite your friends the missions are fun and you can specialize your weapons for different types of enemy factions it is rewarding when you send an arrow flying straight towards an enemy and the arrow impales it to the wall or decapitates it whats more you can play as a trigger happy freak or a careful and silent ninja your choice thirdly if your pocket is itching and you are not one of those patient types then you can spend money to get platinum the premium currency and buy new frames or weapons although since that would defeat the purpose of play to win id recommend buying platinum for $5 or $10 and using it to buy weapon slots or warframe slots that way when you make more weapons or warframes in game youll never run out of space fourthly the login rewards now this is realy interesting you can get the following type of rewards credits ingame currency weapon xp primarysecondarymelee warframe xp warframe blueprints rare materials for crafting discounts on platinum yes you read that last one right discounts and they are heavy ranging from 50% to 90% unbelievable eh makes it so damn cheap to buy platinum fifthly you can create your own playstyle stealth or trigger happiness everything is yours there are plenty of mods available in the game to get your hands on and you can mold your weapon to your will if you are not satisfied with the weapon you crafted sell it sell it and get some credits sixthly there are various alert missions and operations going on every single day in warframe alert mssions give out credits and some rare materials or blueprints you can use them or sell them the blueprints not the rare materials theyre needed for crafting right and the operations give out rare materials and credits too operations can be infestation outbreaks or invasions they give out credits ranging for 10k to 35k still not drooling well ill only say two words space ninjas now if that hasnt watered your mouth then i dont know what will scroll up and get it now you are wasting valuable time

cooperative cyborg space ninja third person action rpg do i have your attention yet having witnessed the evolution of this game from its infancy i can say that it has grown into a unique peice of gaming that will certainly garner its place in the hearts and minds of people coming from just a handful of warframes this games version of character with premade stats to an abundence such that there is almost always one to suit any playstyle within the third person market in terms of graphics it has come a long way the lighting and animations have come to a crisp smoothness that a lot of other freetoplay titles simply havent gotten to the biometal or whatever the suits are made up of look organic but have the deflecting power of metal which makes for an interesting change when youre sliding across a metal surface and hear the suit grinding against the ground combat is almost always fast and fluid with hoards of enemies attempting to do everything in their power from keeping you from your objective with varying enemy types going head long into a wave of enemies can be fun but the unprepared should be ready for a quick death finding your niche is easier since there are plenty of people in the community who are willing to pull you along to get the warframe of your choice by getting you the parts to build it crafting is simple to learn and essencial to maximizing your arsenal as well getting the right gun could just be a matter of getting the materials to build it if it turns out to not be that great sell it off and craft again until you find that one youre willing to put money down to get a orokin catalyst and enhance it further for a fraction of the cost it would have been to purchase the weapon outright who knows you might even find an event and get the catalyst completely free the final and most important element of the game is the mods these can completely alter the way some of the warframes play out even some of the weapons get an extra kick current personal favorite is the kunai throwing knives with a 170% chance of an additional shot at the same time thats right i get the possibility to throw a third with each toss of a blade and deal massive damage finding this kind of combo for your weapon is just a download away enjoy

warframe is a game that you can either love or hate before you start playing it you need to at all times keep in mind that this is still a beta huge and growing but only a beta various bugs are a common sight but developers try to patch them all as well as they can and sometimes even release hotfixes on the run to fix the most annoying ones big packs of new content also come every now and then so the gameplay doesnt get too stale and players find something new to do all the time warframe is a tpp shooter taking place in a futuristic solar system mysterious race known as tenno are cleaning the planetary system from the influence of various factions and the player becomes one of these protectors there are many classes called warframes to choose between each with their own set of skills and statistics but the player gets to pick only one at the start and unlocking other ones might take some time as it required materials and credits although the game is very dynamic and it doesnt take much time to finish a mission or two the game is clearly targeted at players who want to stay for longer the large amount of weaponry and warframes means it will take a lot of playing to unlock and master in addition to that there are mods used for modifying both the weapons and classes resulting in countless combinations where every player can customize hisher equipment according to own taste and preferred gameplay the f2p system means of course that there is a virtual currency in this case platinum available for purchase for everyone willing to spend their hard earned money on the game it can buy weapons materials warframes some visual customization elements etc fortunately unlike many games of this sort it never feels like you absolutely need to buy something because you are too weak comparing others if you have enough time you can spend that instead of real money to acquire desired equipement except visual elements but they do not affect gameplay personally i recommend the game to everyone who likes scifi andor shooters and has a lot of time to spend on this game because it will not let go easily and it will suck you in for at least few dozens of hours for the rest you can always try it after all ninjas play for free
recommended
warframe isnt one of those runofthemill free2play games you often see nowadays yes there are microtransactions and yes there is bought currency however thats where the line is dropped warframe is a game revolving around 1 versus 3 fight with you the tenno against the grineer the corupus and the infested you and three other players in your squad must eliminate these enemies by completing missions and events that are present throughout the game you are given a vast amount of customizability with not only your loadout but your cosmetic appearance weapons are either bought using platnium microtransactions credits achieved through missions and building them using blueprints warframes also occur the same way but may require more work there are around about two hundred different missions ranging from about 1011 planets of our solar system in which each mission has a certain faction tilemap set and objective that is to be accomplished as you challenge this mission however missions with the same objective may seem almost identical which ill explain later frames otherwise known as your character holds completely unique abilities that will aid either you or your allies each frame also has a seperate set of statistics and can be used to suit the needs of the mission you can also enhance not only your weapons but your frames with mods or artifacts these artifacts are obtained through missions and building frames effects of these mods can range from addition armour to enhanced firing speed to poison or elemental damage frame mods can boost attributes such as speed or ability power warframe is completely different from most f2p games as they dont necessarily require you to spend money to get further in game most things can be aquired through playing and gaining levels somethings however that may affect you would be the fact that you cant get more than 23 frames at once unless you buy a frame slot or you cant surpass a certain amount of weapons before you need to buy weapon slots this is not necessarily worrisome in the beginning weeks but it will get to you once you get some more powerful weapons and youd rather not have to sell them in order to get a new weapon same with the frames which is probably the only problem with the microtransations present on this game but they still maintain a fairly reputable system which isnt hogged with this now this may not be early but the game is largely grindy in order to amass a decent chunk of money in order to build or buy youll need to do quite a bit of missions this is another bad downside to the game which can cause boredom once you get past a certain point where fighting and completing missions has become basically worthless also missions of the same gametype may seem extremely identical however the fact that the game is coop makes the game much more enjoyable along with the fact that teamwork is actually needed at times in order to successfully complete a misiion without error the graphics in the game are really well made possibly the best graphics ive seen for a f2p game not only this but the graphics are fairly scalable allowing lowerend computers to run it at the cost of lower graphic fidelity a couple mistakes that dont make much of a different is that the bloom can be massively impairing if you view it at a certain angle the physics engine is a bit derpy as well but it doesnt make any significant difference finally the community of this game is probably one of the better ones ive encountered most people are helpful relatively kind and because its not a competitive game in most aspects insults and such arent flung very often there are some who refuse to work and can be a massive nuisance with this i finally end this crappy review of a decent game personally i suggest you not take my word on this to heart and try the game for yourself now go tenno

warframe is a game which puts you in the shoes of a tenno aka a mother ing space ninja where your job is to kill a bunch of people who look kind of like the emporer from star wars or people with shoe boxes for heads the gameplay is pretty standard for a third person shooter but adds a few unique mechanics that makes the game flow together quite nicely and makes killing waves apon waves of crude clone nerd guys incredibly satisfying the game consists of you doing a bunch of missions that are kind of made obselete as the game is focused  very heavily  around obtaining parts for weapons and warframes this is a good thing and a bad thing because obtaining a new gun or a warframe can completely change the way the game is played but i wont go into that the reason why this is bad is that it makes the game very grindey and passively forces the player into committing to grinding for something to spice up the gameplay as the starter gear is poor and uninteresting  alternatively they can invest their hardearned coin into the game and just get most of the fun stuff through the micro transaction store this sort of forced commitment has lead to a lot of people i know disliking the game as they came in and joined to play with other people who were higher as they felt that the gear they started with was more underwhelming and it put them off the game a little although this isnt much of a review as more of just throwing some thoughts onto steam without using spellcheck i wanted to say something about the game as i have poured a lot of my time and money into it because the game is so satisfying and fresh when you invest your time into to it in the way i have id like to say to anyone that picks this up as a try for a free to play game that its a game where you may love it from the start but you may also have to invest you time or money in to get the same amount of enjoyment as others

warframe is practically the computer version of clash of clans figuratively it will addict you with hours of gameplay that keep you coming back with the just one more level feeling the graphics are amazing i play on low graphics settings for qualitys sake and the game looks comparable to halo 4 on the xbox 360 in terms of detail your eyeballs are in for a treat the levels are all the same structure you move from room to room murdering everything in your path with guns to bow and arrows to shurikens etc there are different level types exterminate spy assassinate defense survival sabotage and mobile defense each of these levels has a different objective that i am not going in depth ofmainly because the title says it all but they last 1015 minutes usually the length of the mission really depends on how far you are willing to push yourself are you going to murder an entire army or just the standing garisson the choice is yours this game has full clan support trading friends text chat and even a pvp multiplayer duel mode where up to 4 people can duke it out to see whose ninja skills are superior all in all its a great game for being free and even though repetitiveness sinks in quickly the tutorial doesnt give a lot of info and the storyline is nonexistent its fun and thats all games are supposed to be for the few gigabytes its worth i give warframe a 810

recommended
warframe is a pretty interesting game if youre reading this you probably already know that it is a coop shooter from somewhere and that it is in open beta the first thing i want to let you know is that these two categories are not seperate at all the core of this game is as much a shooter as it is a game in development a game that experiments and teaches both the community and the developers and of course a game with many unfinished features there are upsides and downsides to digital extremes decision of developing their game like this but i am without a doubt that the impact of saying lets release it publicly in beta and develop it as we go with our players on the end product of this game will be even greater than when they said lets make a space ninja coop shooter f2p game i could write about the stunning visuals that easily outmatch any f2p game to date i could write about the constantly evolving storyline and setting that seem as basic and simple as it is limitless or i could even write about the gameplay that easily combines a dozen different styles of games into one fastpaced progressionfilled insanity but i wont these arent what keep me in this game what keeps me in this game is the development itself the slowly building community and the potential this game has the developers themselves clearly learn a lot with every hotfix and update they release and it makes progressing through this game all the more interesting  seeing as the game is progressing alongside you a normal company would learn quietly through data and attempting different things internally but warframe has by far the most communityinvolved development team i have ever had the pleasure of interacting with this game is an experiment and so far it looks like its a successful one its still pretty far away from completion though you can choose whether you want to participate now or maybe youd prefer it as a more refined product you could choose any amount of time focus and interest that you would like to invest in this game and its development and it will adjust itself accordingly so yeah i recommend you try out warframe
